title: Can you restore a session with crash files?
content:
I need to recover a `.jsonlz4` file to restore a Firefox session with 8 active instances, as the "Restore Session" feature only opened 5 due to the `browser.sessionstore.max_windows_undo` setting being capped at 5, and the full original `.jsonlz4` file is now missing.

In the`firefox/Crash Reports` directory, there are numerous files I can’t interpret, can I retrieve my session data via telemetry or other methods using this crash information. I’m using Linux Mint with Flatpak Firefox, and I also have crash logs containing a "last crash" text file and a string of numbers, could these be useful for getting back my session?

title: http://www.w3.org/2000/svg
content:
<meta charset="UTF-8"> <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0"> <title>Misty Dashboard</title> <script src="https://cdn.tailwindcss.com"></script> <script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/chart.js"></script> <script type="module"> import { initializeApp } from "https://www.gstatic.com/firebasejs/11.6.1/firebase-app.js"; import { getAuth, signInAnonymously, signInWithCustomToken, onAuthStateChanged, setLogLevel } from "https://www.gstatic.com/firebasejs/11.6.1/firebase-auth.js"; import { getFirestore, doc, setDoc, onSnapshot } from "https://www.gstatic.com/firebasejs/11.6.1/firebase-firestore.js"; // Firebase Configuration const firebaseConfig = JSON.parse(typeof firebaseconfig !== 'undefined' ? firebaseconfig : '{}'); const initialAuthToken = typeof initialauthtoken !== 'undefined' ? initialauthtoken : null; const appId = typeof appid !== 'undefined' ? appid : 'default-app-id'; // --- Firebase Initialization and Auth --- const app = initializeApp(firebaseConfig); const auth = getAuth(app); const db = getFirestore(app); setLogLevel('Debug'); let userId = null; let isAuthReady = false; const loadingTextEl = document.getElementById('loadingText'); const contentEl = document.getElementById('content'); const userIdDisplayEl = document.getElementById('userIdDisplay'); const dashboardId = 'shared-dashboard'; // Unique ID for the public dashboard async function authenticateUser() { try { if (initialAuthToken) { await signInWithCustomToken(auth, initialAuthToken); } else { await signInAnonymously(auth); } } catch (error) { console.error("Firebase Auth error:", error); loadingTextEl.textContent = "Authentication failed. Please refresh."; } } authenticateUser(); onAuthStateChanged(auth, async (user) => { if (user) { userId = user.uid; userIdDisplayEl.textContent = userId; isAuthReady = true; loadingTextEl.style.display = 'none'; contentEl.style.display = 'flex'; listenForDashboardData(); } else { if (!initialAuthToken) { userId = crypto.randomUUID(); userIdDisplayEl.textContent = userId; isAuthReady = true; loadingTextEl.style.display = 'none'; contentEl.style.display = 'flex'; listenForDashboardData(); } } }); // --- Firestore Data Functions --- const dashboardDocRef = () => { const collectionPath = /artifacts/${appId}/public/data/dashboardData; return doc(db, collectionPath, dashboardId); }; const listenForDashboardData = () => { if (!isAuthReady) { console.warn("Auth not ready. Skipping Firestore listener."); return; } onSnapshot(dashboardDocRef(), (doc) => { if (doc.exists()) { const data = doc.data(); updateUI(data); } else { console.log("No existing dashboard data. Initializing with default values."); initializeDashboard(); } }, (error) => { console.error("Error listening to dashboard data:", error); }); }; const updateDashboardInFirestore = async (data) => { if (!isAuthReady) { console.warn("Cannot update. Auth state not ready."); return; } try { await setDoc(dashboardDocRef(), data, { merge: true }); } catch (error) { console.error("Error writing document:", error); } }; const initializeDashboard = async () => { const initialData = { totalValue: 265.5, marketValuation: 200.7, jurisdictions: 46 }; await updateDashboardInFirestore(initialData); }; // --- UI and Chart Functions --- const totalValueEl = document.getElementById('totalValue'); const marketValuationEl = document.getElementById('marketValuation'); const jurisdictionsEl = document.getElementById('jurisdictions'); const refreshBtn = document.getElementById('refreshBtn'); const shareBtn = document.getElementById('shareBtn'); const marketChartCanvas = document.getElementById('marketChart'); let marketChart; let chartData = { labels: ['Jun'], datasets: [{ label: 'Market Valuation (B)', data: [200.7], borderColor: '#48BB78', backgroundColor: 'rgba(72, 187, 120, 0.2)', fill: true, tension: 0.4 }] }; const createChart = () => { if (marketChart) marketChart.destroy(); marketChart = new Chart(marketChartCanvas.getContext('2d'), { type: 'line', data: chartData, options: { responsive: true, maintainAspectRatio: false, scales: { x: { grid: { color: 'rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.1)' }, ticks: { color: 'white' } }, y: { grid: { color: 'rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.1)' }, ticks: { color: 'white' } } }, plugins: { legend: { labels: { color: 'white' } } } } }); }; const updateUI = (data) => { totalValueEl.textContent = $${data.totalValue.toFixed(1)}B; marketValuationEl.textContent = $${data.marketValuation.toFixed(1)}B; jurisdictionsEl.textContent = data.jurisdictions; }; const generateRandomData = () => { const currentTotal = parseFloat(totalValueEl.textContent.replace('$', '').replace('B', '')); const currentMarket = parseFloat(marketValuationEl.textContent.replace('$', '').replace('B', '')); const newTotal = (currentTotal + (Math.random() - 0.5) * 2).toFixed(1); const newMarket = (currentMarket + (Math.random() - 0.5) * 1.5).toFixed(1); const newJurisdictions = Math.floor(46 + (Math.random() * 5)); return { totalValue: parseFloat(newTotal), marketValuation: parseFloat(newMarket), jurisdictions: newJurisdictions }; }; // Event listener for Refresh button refreshBtn.addEventListener('click', () => { const newData = generateRandomData(); updateDashboardInFirestore(newData); refreshBtn.textContent = 'Refreshing...'; setTimeout(() => { refreshBtn.textContent = 'Refresh Data'; }, 1000); }); // Event listener for Share button shareBtn.addEventListener('click', () => { const link = window.location.href; navigator.clipboard.writeText(link) .then(() => { shareBtn.textContent = 'Link Copied!'; setTimeout(() => { shareBtn.textContent = 'Share'; }, 2000); }) .catch(err => { console.error('Could not copy text: ', err); }); }); window.onload = function() { createChart(); }; </script> <style> @import url('https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Inter:wght@400;500;600;700&display=swap'); body { font-family: 'Inter', sans-serif; } canvas { background: #2D3748; border-radius: 0.75rem; } </style>

title: path changes with each new version, breaking desktop shortcut
content:
Hi -- Not a major issue, but for a while now each firefox.exe version installs itself in a new directory, requiring me to recreate its desktop shortcut. This is new behavior; I never needed to do this previously.

So I end up with 

 C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\Mozilla.Firefox_139.0.4.0_x64__n80bbvh6b1yt2\VFS\ProgramFiles\Firefox Package Root  C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\Mozilla.Firefox_142.0.0.0_x64__n80bbvh6b1yt2\VFS\ProgramFiles\Firefox Package Root  C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\Mozilla.Firefox_142.0.1.0_x64__n80bbvh6b1yt2\VFS\ProgramFiles\Firefox Package Root

The most recent update went to 

 C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\Mozilla.Firefox_143.0.0.0_x64__n80bbvh6b1yt2\VFS\ProgramFiles\Firefox Package Root

Can you advise.

Thanks!

title: Widget video di Wordpress non si attivano su Firefox
content:
Buongiorno,

Gestisco un sito su WordPress, e ho notato che i widget video (con link che rimanda a YouTube) non funzionano, lasciando al loro posto solo uno spazio bianco. Tuttavia, questi funzionano senza problemi su Chrome e Microsoft Edge, il che mi conferma che il problema dipende dal browser.

Ho già controllato gli aggiornamenti, svuotato la cache (sia del browser che del sito), rimosso le estensioni e seguito altre guide ufficiali di Firefox, ma senza successo.

Se qualcuno ha delle idee, sarei ben felice di sentirle!

Grazie mille

Secure Connection Failed

The connection to www.newsmax.com was interrupted while the page was loading.

Learn more…

There are no other sites in which I have this problem with FF x64 DE. In Edge, I see the newsmax pages load while the FF x64 DE https//newsmax.com xontinues to genberate the above message and fails to load the screen.

Please fix.

title: How to get Firefox to stop promoting Nazi content
content:
I've been a very long time Firefox user, and have for many years been aghast at how prominently Firefox promotes a virulently antisemitic paper called "The Guardian" on its recommended stories. Every time I see it, I thumbs it down, and have been doing so for years, hoping that eventually the algorithm would stop recommending that junk to me. I have NEVER clicked a link to "The Guardian" from the recommended stories page either, not even once. I'll often see 2-3 links from this virulently antisemitic paper and thumb each one down. Why does the algorithm keep recommending it to me? I know that I can turn off Recommended stories, however I like the content, and have found a lot of interesting stuff through it. Why is Firefox relentlessly pushing Nazis propaganda?

(If you don't think The Guardian pushes virulently antisemitic Nazi propaganda, I would be happy to share links demonstrating how it does exactly that, but since this is a new account, I don't want the algorithm to think I'm spamming.)
creator: LaurenS

title: Can't add a Bookmarklet to Bookmark Menu. Any solutions?
content:
Hi all. I'm trying to add Instapaper's 'Send to Kindle Bookmarklet' to the Menu Bar of Firefox on Mac and it won't work.

I've followed Mozilla suggestions when bookmarklets fail to add (essentially it's about making sure the places.sqlite-wal file in the Profiles folder is unlocked -- which it now is), but nothing changes.

Following other articles online, I've discovered that Bookmarklets in general (ie not just this one) won't install, though I have cookies temporarily off, pop-ups temporarily unblocked, the specific site marked as an exception etc, but nothing works.

Because it's not just an Instapaper issue, I'm hoping someone here more tech-minded than me might know the solution.

Many thanks in anticipation.

title: tabs become unselectable and can't be dragged out of the main window
content:
This started happening a few days ago.

I tried to drag a tab out of the main window to put it in its own window on my other monitor, but the tab just became unselectable, and if i scrolled in the tab bar, the tab icon and text would remain locked in place in the display while the other tabs moved behind it.

The main Firefox window also lost the minimize, restore, and close buttons. The only way to make the tabs work was to close Firefox and relaunch it.

I noticed this happened only after any app in the OS went full screen, be it a steam game, or another Firefox window, or a VLC window, or anything else that I did that made an app full screen in any of my monitors.

I am using Ubuntu 24.04 with KDE Plasma 5.27.12. Kernel is 6.14.0-29. Display server is Wayland.

Initially I thought this could be a problem with the snap version of Firefox, so now I've installed the deb package, but the problem remains. Firefox is the only app which presents a problem of any kind when any window goes full screen.

Here's a video showing what the problem looks like, in case my description was not clear. The ghostly tab in this video is the chess.com home page and you can see it as the third tab from the top right of the video, and it remains in that position as i scroll the other tabs, completely unselectable with the mouse.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-mAfPS3_qkg

Any idea of what could be causing this issue to appear?

Thank you!

title: Voice input not supported in Firefox for Google Translate
content:
I am a Firefox user for the last 20 years. I frequently use Google Translate, and I depend on the voice-to-text feature. However, when I try to use it in Firefox, I get the message: “Voice input is not supported on this browser.”

Because of this, I am being forced to switch to Google Chrome, which I don’t really want to do. Is there any workaround, add-on, or upcoming plan to bring proper voice input support to Firefox?

title: Hide feature-news balloons?
content:
Hi, so my problem is I need to keep using the keyboard for surfing the net on my Windows PC, because of pain issues with using the mouse too often. The most difficult part is that Firefox comes with a lot of these top-most balloons with feature suggestions like "did you know you can use an AI bar now..." etc.

Btw, I don't mean any popups from websites. Mozilla just shows the feature info balloons (or tool tips?) when you are on a website, but it's never the website that bothers me.

There is no way to hide these mozilla popups using the keyboard except opening a new tab with Ctrl+T.

So... is there anything to get rid off all feature-news or mozilla-suggesions etc?

Thank you!

title: Cursor select moves unexpectedly when Korean->Hanja converting
content:
So there's a function where you select Korean character ㄱ~ㅎ and press Hanja(Han/Chinese letter) Convert key, you can convert it to special symbols

The issue is: when you press Convert key while inputting a word without space, it automatically selects the first letter of the word(Yes the text cursor moves front itself)

In every website includes search bar

You need to menually select a letter by mouse drag or shift key And then press Convert key to show the intented converting list

Idk how long it's been but the issue is pretty old

Additionally, you have intermittent Korean letter seperating issue, too("한글" -> "ㅎㅏㄴㄱㅡㄹ")

(For who suffer from the same issue, you can use Naver Whale browser instead)

title: Firefox applet/wrapper for individual profiles constantly asking for system permissions on MacOS
content:
I have some custom firefox applets that acts as wrappers around the command-line functions to open firefox with specific profiles (see image 1 of applets in Applications in Finder). Each application is a simple .scpt file that runs the shell script (see image 2).

This allows me to have specific app icons for the different firefox profiles in my user dock (see image 3).

The issue is that once the applet is used and firefox has been opened, there are issues with permissions. In settings, it is clear that both microphone and speaker permissions have been shared with the applets AND firefox itself (see image 4).

However, any time I navigate to a page, I get a dialogue asking if the applet (Firefox_Professional, in this case) can access the microphone (see image 5). Depending on the page, I can get 1-20 dialogues in a row. This makes firefox practically unusable since I am closing an average of 5 dialogues before I can view any page.

Does anyone know any solutions to this?

Thanks so much for the help! ~Alex
creator: alexrsathler

title: Google Gemini graphs are not displayed in Firefox (actively removed)
content:
Graphs generated by Google Gemini Pro 2.5 do not display in Firefox. They are generated and then quickly removed from the display by something in Firefox. I am not running any adblocker software or extensions other than anything that is native to Firefox. I have tried changing about everything possible in the privacy settings and have not been able to fix it.

Here is what Gemini says it does when it generates a graph versus a AI generated picture.

Data Visualization (The "Graph") 📊

When you ask me to "graph," "plot," or "chart" data (like a drag polar), I use a Code Interpreter.

My Process: I write and execute Python code using a data visualization library (Matplotlib). This code performs calculations and generates a brand-new chart from scratch.

Why It Fails to Display: The resulting image is a piece of procedurally generated content. The way it's embedded in the page is more complex than a standard image. Aggressive ad blockers or strict browser privacy settings often mistake this type of dynamic content for a pop-up, an ad, or a tracker, and they actively block it from appearing—which is what causes the "appears and then disappears" issue you described.

Any help you can provide would be greatly appreciated. Thanks.
creator: duff2

title: Somehow got 'infected' by a web app and want to get rid of it
content:
I was going to random name generator sites yesterday and I went to one that is called www.behindaname.com and it 'dropped' a web app into my firefox browser somehow. I am running version 143.0.1

Now, there is an icon in the taskbar, right in the address box between toggle reader view and bookmark this page. When you hover over it, it drops a popup message "add tab to taskbar".

In my Windows 10 menu, it shows under recently added on the start menu, as "behindaname"

If you right click on this and click on 'open file location' it opens a directory "C:\Users\Steve\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Firefox Web Apps" and in this directory is behindaname and under file type .lnk

If you right click on the recently added on start menu "behindaname", and select uninstall, it opens up the Windows 10 uninstall menu, but it isn't listed in there anywhere.

if you rightclick that behindaname.lnk and click on properties, under Target : it gives "C:\Program Files\Mozilla Firefox\firefox.exe" "-taskbar-tab" "b3fa7206-2a6c-4b7b-9427-c051524970ed" "-new-window" "https://www.behindaname.com" "-profile" "C:\Users\Steve\AppData\Roaming\Mozilla\Firefox\Profiles\1ippdfls.default-release" "-container" "0"

I would just delete the link, but since it is putting that icon on my taskbar and it is giving that target, it is hiding somewhere. I am just not up to speed on web apps and other browser malware, at least I consider it browswer malware, to know what is going on and how to completely get rid of it. I would appreciate any help anyone can give me. Thank you, Steve
creator: steveh_661
